title: Introducing the Wrenchmen
body:
Help & Support Wrenchmen

Wrenchmen are members of Riot's Volunteer Program. They can help assist you with common technical problems and are recognized as community leaders by Riot Games. Because they are not Riot staff members, Wrenchmen can't answer all questions, but they can help you find resources and show you how to get in contact with Player Support.

Look for their special orange color and Wrench Icon!

http://i.imgur.com/uhyeSmO.png

Current Wrenchmen are;
Wuks
SephirothSG

Q: I want to help! How can I join the Wrenchmen?

We’re always on the lookout for potential Wrenchmen, but we do so with the mentality that actions speak louder than words. If you’d like to wear the badge of a Wrenchmen, show us that you can do it by continuing to help answer the questions of your fellow summoners in a friendly and professional manner. We’ll be watching!

Hey double A!

So right now, the Riot Games Volunteer Programs consists of a few programs across different regions; I have the privilege of working with both the North American and Oceanic regional programs. 

On the North American Boards, we have the Arbiters Program, which is addresses player behavior related topics, and looks to provide clarity and facilitate discussions on those subjects. 

On the Oceania Boards, we have the Wrenchmen Program (Help & Support), Emissaries (Player Behavior), and Instructors (Gameplay), each working to provide more information about their respective subjects and work with the other volunteer programs when possible. 

All volunteers have been seasoned veterans in their subject matters; before I became a Wrenchman, I'd been posted in Help & Support for about 7 months prior. I would hop on the forums/Boards whenever I had some time to kill and just tried to answer peoples' questions as best I could. We keep an active lookout for active posters on both North America and Oceania, so just stay positive and work to help people in areas that you're interested. Thanks for your interest!
